programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces around the nation to discover how CCTV and technological advances are helping to bring criminals to justice. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S02E04

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A drug dealer who has been driving dangerously reveals a surprising amount of information when he is pulled over, and friends try to baffle the pursuit team by changing their names. Meanwhile, an officer has a shock in store for a law-breaking driver
S04E05

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Two known offenders end up in trouble again after a high-speed chase through Sheffield. An encounter with a gang of hoodies leads to a close shave for one officer, another goes in pursuit of a four-legged fugitive, and a Lamborghini turns out to be not all it seems
S04E07

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A helicopter is used in the pursuit of an armed robber, ending in a serious accident. A sniffer dog makes a discovery, a fraudster is taken into custody and a gang of lorry thieves is pursued in a major manhunt. Plus, new recruits at South Yorkshire's Road Crime Unit are put to the test by a pair of suspected burglars
S04E09

programme.title: Broken Arrow (1950)
programme.desc: A former Union scout is befriended by famed chief Cochise after he saves the life of a native boy. Having witnessed 10 years of conflict between Apaches and advancing settlers, the veteran soldier seizes the fleeting chance to broker a ceasefire between the two sides. Western, starring James Stewart, Jeff Chandler, Debra Paget and Basil Ruysdael

programme.title: Raid on Entebbe (1977)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama recounting the Israeli raid on Uganda's Entebbe airport, where more than 100 passengers were being held hostage on board a hijacked airliner in 1976. As the world waits, the authorities launch a daring operation to free the prisoners. Starring Peter Finch, Martin Balsam, Horst Buchholz, Jack Warden and Sylvia Sidney

programme.title: Dances with Wolves (1990)
programme.desc: A Union army officer during the American Civil War requests a posting to a remote outpost on the frontier. Left to man a deserted fort single-handedly, he is gradually adopted into a local Sioux tribe - but they are endangered when his former comrades come looking for him. Oscar-winning Western, directed by and starring Kevin Costner. With Mary McDonnell, Graham Greene, Rodney A Grant and Floyd Red Crow Westerman

programme.title: Max Payne (2008)
programme.desc: A tormented cop searches in vain for the man who killed his wife while also investigating a series of murders connected to an experimental drug that causes nightmarish hallucinations. However, he finds himself pursued by a vengeful woman who thinks he was involved in the death of her sister. Action thriller, based on the video game, starring Mark Wahlberg, Mila Kunis and Beau Bridges

programme.title: Mercury Rising (1998)
programme.desc: A top-secret government agency has developed a seemingly unbreakable code - only for an autistic boy to crack it in an instant. Thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alec Baldwin and Miko Hughes

programme.title: The Gunfighter (1950)
programme.desc: Gunslinger Jimmy Ringo looks forward to a life of domestic peace after being given a chance to settle down with his once estranged wife and their child. However, a young upstart with dreams of slaying a legend challenges Ringo to a gunfight but dies, setting his three vengeful brothers on the older man's trail. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Millard Mitchell, Karl Malden and Helen Westcott

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Documentary following the work of high-speed interception teams, this time with access to the officers of Cumbria's Roads Policing Unit. Glen has a busy night in Barrow-in-Furness dealing with a drunk and a runaway knifeman, and Colin detains a suspected drug dealer who has a wrap of heroin hidden in a very intimate place. Countryside and city collide when Duggie has to tackle a trailer full of cows that has overturned, blocking the main carriageway into Carlisle, while the alcohol-fuelled actions of one driver send officers rushing to evacuate villagers in the middle of the night after a crash ruptures a gas main
S05E01

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PCs Matt Turner and Rich Woodward are on the tail of an uninsured vehicle. When they finally catch up to the vehicle and question the suspect, they're surprised to discover the driver has never taken a driving test. On the M6, Inspector Anton Sullivan is responding to a collision between a car and an HGV. As the HGV has stopped on a live lane, Anton is tasked with trying to stop traffic, across six busy lanes, while in an unmarked police vehicle
S03E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A stick of dynamite causes chaos for Duggie when it is brought into Carlisle's main police station and the armed response unit is called out after there is a report of a gun being spotted in a city centre bar. Duncan receives a shock when a cyclist who has been trapped under a car turns out to be someone he knows, officers haul in a driver who is well over the limit and Hayley comes to the rescue when a teenager's car hits a wall during a late-night drive. Documentary following the work of Cumbria's Roads Policing Unit
S05E02

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Trouble on the Terraces: This episode reveals incredible stories of disorder, from the very top of the national game to the bottom
S06E09

programme.title: Inside HMP Frankland: Evil Behind Bars
programme.desc: Documentary exploring life inside HMP Frankland, the men's maximum security prison in County Durham, which has housed some of the country's most notorious criminals, including Peter Sutcliffe, Ian Huntley and Delroy Grant. The programme recounts some of the violent prison attacks that have taken place over the years, including one so horrifying that it forced a staff member to retire. Later, an ex-prisoner shares how he passed the time in Frankland's segregation unit by organising a quiz through the cell windows

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Mary Berry - Love to Cook
programme.desc:
Mary cooks four recipes that prove watching the pennies does not mean having to sacrifice on flavour. They include a crab courgetti spaghetti dish that uses tinned fish at a fraction of the cost of fresh. Plus, a spinach filo swirl demonstrates an inventive way of stretching six sausages to feed the family
S01E06

programme.title: FA Cup Football
programme.desc: A reimagined look back at the 2022/23 season's gripping FA Cup journey through a homage to classic video games

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.desc: Aylesbury & Liphook (Extended): Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers create a sensory garden for two autistic girls in Aylesbury, while also providing a garden in Liphook for Anne, Shaun and daughter Joanne

programme.desc:

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc:
Armour Plated: Iain is called out to a multi-vehicle crash caused by a man jumping from a bridge. The crisis forces him to relive traumatic memories of the events that led to his partner's death, and makes him question his relationship with a still struggling Faith. Jodie comes to see a different side to her father, Cam finds himself lodging with unexpected company, and Paige receives some troubling news
S37E33

programme.title: Annika
programme.desc:
A scientist's body is found in Loch Katrine, a case that reminds Annika of a play by Ibsen. But with so many people wanting the victim dead, which one did he push over the edge? Away from work, the DI takes more than a parental interest in Morgan's therapist. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker
S01E03

programme.title: Lionel Messi: Destiny
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes documentary looking at how the Argentina star, won the World Cup for the first time in his illustrious career last year in Qatar. With contributions from his international teammates, including Premier League stars Emi Martinez, Alexix Mac Allister and Julian Alvarez, and manager Lionel Scaloni

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United. Jason Mohammad presents highlights of the final between the rivals, which came from Wembley Stadium. With analysis from Jermaine Jenas

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Cornwall (Extended Version): Steve Brown helps a couple from Hertfordshire to find a new home in their favourite holiday destination of Cornwall, as well as meeting a local ceramicist

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish
S01E03

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Clissold Park, Stoke Newington 2: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann
S45E16

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc:
Annie invites Terry to Marlene's party in the hope that it will help him to make a fresh start. But seeing a carefree and integrated Annie only makes Terry feel like more of an outsider and his PTSD spirals. With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation
S01E04

programme.desc: Linda struggles with the Knight family invasion on the Vic and George speaks to Phil about a collaboration with the Boxing Den. Things are tense with the Panesars and Eve and Suki find their chance to get rid of Nish for good

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc:
Paul insists on having Kappen's body exhumed. Jackie reluctantly allows it, but warns him that a wrong step could fatally compromise the force's reputation. At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands
S01E04

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc:

Myles causes problems for Joe who is already reeling from an unexpected visitor, leaving him and Mike feeling uncertain about the future
S12E04

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.desc:

programme.title: Ghosts US

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. With contributions from his international teammates, including Premier League stars Emi Martinez, Alexix Mac Allister and Julian Alvarez, and manager Lionel Scaloni

programme.title: Match of the Day: The FA Cup

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish
S01E03

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:

Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann
S45E16

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms

With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:

Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more
S20E02

Lee and Chris set about creating the perfect garden that pleases both on a £5,000 budget

Back on the estate, the pair are forced to deal with the consequences of their drug-dealing activities - at which point Dom receives a call from Celia Herrington, offering them freedom from the gang in return for the dossier. programme.desc: A girl is possessed by a formidable demonic entity that resists all efforts at freeing her from its grasp. In desperation, the child's mother appeals for help from a local priest and a veteran exorcist, but succeeding in this nightmarish contest of wills threatens the lives of both men. William Friedkin's horror, starring Linda Blair, Jason Miller, Ellen Burstyn, Max von Sydow and Lee J Cobb

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann

programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

Emilia and her sister Maya love nothing more than playing in the garden, but currently it's unsafe and needs to be redesigned with more forgiving materials so they don't hurt themselves. Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. programme.desc:

After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.desc:

After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. The crisis forces him to relive traumatic memories of the events that led to his partner's death, and makes him question his relationship with a still struggling Faith. Jodie comes to see a different side to her father, Cam finds himself lodging with unexpected company, and Paige receives some troubling news

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish
S01E03

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Clissold Park, Stoke Newington 2: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann
S45E16

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms

With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation

programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:

Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu continue to clash over the Arches and things get worse as Sonia and Reiss invite themselves over for the evening, forcing them to play host. Jay shares Lola's memory box with Kim and Billy and his friends realise just how much he is struggling with the grief

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years
S01E01

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Alastair and Anna live in Winchester, Hampshire, and badly need their sloped garden transformed into a curvaceous country cottage idyll. They want to grow vegetables as well as have an entertaining area - all a challenge with the different levels. Charlie Dimmock and Arit Anderson take up the challenge on a budget of £5,500

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more
S20E02

programme.desc: Northern Ireland gymnast Rhys McClenaghan has won medals at all of the major international competitions. This documentary follows him as he takes part in 2022's three biggest events - the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham, the European Championships in Munich and the Gymnastics World Championships in Liverpool. In what was the toughest year of the 23-year-old's career so far, it offers an insight into his relentless training schedule and hears about the personal and physical sacrifices that come with being an elite athlete

Back on the estate, the pair are forced to deal with the consequences of their drug-dealing activities - at which point Dom receives a call from Celia Herrington, offering them freedom from the gang in return for the dossier. programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda struggles with the Knight family invasion on the Vic and George speaks to Phil about a collaboration with the Boxing Den. Things are tense with the Panesars and Eve and Suki find their chance to get rid of Nish for good

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc:
Paul insists on having Kappen's body exhumed. Jackie reluctantly allows it, but warns him that a wrong step could fatally compromise the force's reputation. At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands
S01E04

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s
S08E05

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa
S09E03

Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years
S01E01

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Alastair and Anna live in Winchester, Hampshire, and badly need their sloped garden transformed into a curvaceous country cottage idyll. They want to grow vegetables as well as have an entertaining area - all a challenge with the different levels. Charlie Dimmock and Arit Anderson take up the challenge on a budget of £5,500

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more
S20E02

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. programme.desc:

Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean

The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:

Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more
S20E02

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Cornwall (Extended Version): Steve Brown helps a couple from Hertfordshire to find a new home in their favourite holiday destination of Cornwall, as well as meeting a local ceramicist

programme.title: Paddington (2014)
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish
S01E03

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: South Today
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Clissold Park, Stoke Newington 2: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Clissold Park, Stoke Newington, where treasures include Lewis Hamilton's racing helmet, Scandinavian jewellery and memorabilia from the movie Blade Runner. Marc Allum hears the inspiring story of the British Reggae Artists Famine Appeal, a fundraising response to Live Aid in 1985, while Will Farmer inspects a perspex mermaid sculpture by Arthur Fleischmann
S45E16

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms
programme.desc:
Annie invites Terry to Marlene's party in the hope that it will help him to make a fresh start. But seeing a carefree and integrated Annie only makes Terry feel like more of an outsider and his PTSD spirals. With her parents out all night, Pattie tries to confront her problems head on and ends up in a dangerous situation
S01E04

programme.desc: Divorcee Toby Howard and his ex-con older brother Tanner embark on a meticulously-planned crime spree, hoping to rob every branch of the West Texas bank that has threatened to foreclose on their family ranch. However, they soon find themselves being pursued by two veteran Texas Rangers. Neo-western drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Chris Pine and Ben Foster

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc:
Paul insists on having Kappen's body exhumed. Jackie reluctantly allows it, but warns him that a wrong step could fatally compromise the force's reputation. At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands
S01E04

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s
S08E05

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa
S09E03

Emilia and her sister Maya love nothing more than playing in the garden, but currently it's unsafe and needs to be redesigned with more forgiving materials so they don't hurt themselves. Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years
S01E01

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Alastair and Anna live in Winchester, Hampshire, and badly need their sloped garden transformed into a curvaceous country cottage idyll. They want to grow vegetables as well as have an entertaining area - all a challenge with the different levels. Charlie Dimmock and Arit Anderson take up the challenge on a budget of £5,500

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more
S20E02

Lee and Chris set about creating the perfect garden that pleases both on a £5,000 budget

The team has just 24 hours and a limited budget to make Adam and Jen's home child friendly

programme.desc: Northern Ireland gymnast Rhys McClenaghan has won medals at all of the major international competitions. This documentary follows him as he takes part in 2022's three biggest events - the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham, the European Championships in Munich and the Gymnastics World Championships in Liverpool. In what was the toughest year of the 23-year-old's career so far, it offers an insight into his relentless training schedule and hears about the personal and physical sacrifices that come with being an elite athlete

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel
