programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:

The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant
S01E01

By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more
S20E02

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. programme.desc:

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean

The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc:
The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s
S08E05

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc:
The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa
S09E03

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years
S01E01

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more
S20E02

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. programme.desc:

Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.
S2023E23

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:
Deep Thinkers: Disguised underwater cameras capture footage of sea creatures. The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Protecting Primates: With more than half of the world's primates under threat of extinction, Chris Packham narrates a look at what is being done to protect primates, with scientists making ground-breaking discoveries about this remarkable animal family. Researcher Dr Cat Hobaiter has spent 13 years studying chimpanzees in the jungles of Uganda, while on Thailand's East coast, Dr Amanda Tan reveals how long-tailed macaques use tools to harvest shellfish

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Lower Hampen: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker are at Lower Hampen Farm in the Cotswolds to meet Lydia and Clive Handy who have turned back the clock to adopt a more traditional approach to farming. Matt weaves a yarn, using wool from the farm's rare breed sheep, and Charlotte lifts the lid on soil microbiology and how it could impact the way we grow our food in the future. Adam Henson looks at a major food fraud in the British pig industry and Tom Heap investigates how food price inflation could impact the nation's health.

programme.title: Spy in the Ocean
programme.desc:

The first episode features the most intelligent animals in the ocean, including sperm whales and octopuses, which are shown using improvised tools to fend off rivals. The programme also features puffer fish creating sand sculptures and a hermit crab that becomes an unwitting documentary-maker after it steals the shell with a spy camera in. Narrated by David Tennant

The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

Emilia and her sister Maya love nothing more than playing in the garden, but currently it's unsafe and needs to be redesigned with more forgiving materials so they don't hurt themselves. Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc:
Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Claire Foy: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more
S20E02

programme.title: Iorram - Boat Song
programme.desc: A cinema documentary entirely in Scottish Gaelic, Iorram (Boat Song) is a lyrical portrait of life in Scotland's Outer Hebrides, past and present. Director Alastair Cole takes the audience on an immersive journey into the heart and soul of a 1000-year-old community, blending archive sound recordings of voices from the past with visuals of island life today and an original score by acclaimed folk musician Aidan O'Rourke. At the core of the film is an extraordinary trove of sound archive, recorded by pioneering Scottish ethnographers in the mid-20th century, who visited the Western Isles to capture the hardship and romance of life lived in precarious balance with the sea. These newly restored recordings preserve an oral history of lore and legends, tall tales and tragedies, passed down through generations of Gaelic speakers. This soundtrack of voices, stories and songs from the past is accompanied by moving imagery of the daily working rhythm of the islands, on land and on water, shot ov

programme.title: Trusadh (Compelling Stories)
programme.desc:
Beatha air an Oir/Lost Villages: Evelyn meets up with Torquil MacLeod, who has strong family connections to Stemreway, and with John MacDonald, whose ancestors came from Buhanais which was cleared in 1826. She also visits Ungashader in Uig in the company of Kenny Angus Mackay and she gets an opportunity to visit another village situated in Loch Hamnaway near the Harris border
S14E12

programme.title: Bannan (The Ties That Bind)
programme.desc: The story of a woman's return home to the island from which she escaped eight years previously, having left her family and the place, its claustrophobia and customs. programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Women in Charge: Is India Changing?
programme.desc: For so long, women in India have fought for equality at home and the right to be in charge of their families. Now as India marches on to be the world's most populous country, a mini revolution is taking place. Divya Arya meets some of the women, helped by migration and education, who have become the head of their families, and asks what impact it will have on the one point four billion people that now live in India?

programme.title: Ukraine: The Missing Children
programme.desc: Russia has been accused of multiple war crimes in Ukraine since the start of its full-scale invasion. But it was allegations of the illegal deportation of children that led to an international arrest warrant being issued for Vladimir Putin himself. Ukraine says more than 19,000 children have been removed to Russia. Russia maintains that it is evacuating them from danger. The BBC's Eastern Europe correspondent Sarah Rainsford has found new evidence of what is happening to Ukraine's missing children and met some of the relatives fighting to get them back.

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Russia is supplying the Myanmar military with advanced fighter jets and training their pilots how to use them in a war against their own people. More than two years on from the coup, the country's military is facing a countrywide armed uprising and their troops are struggling to hold ground and recruit foot soldiers. So, the strategy is turning increasingly to the air with devastating consequences. BBC's Asia editor Rebecca Henschke follows those fighting back on the ground and in the air. And she meets defectors from the air force who give exclusive insight into the strategy and psychology behind those operating these deadly machines.

programme.title: Ukraine: The Missing Children
programme.desc: Russia has been accused of multiple war crimes in Ukraine since the start of its full-scale invasion. But it was allegations of the illegal deportation of children that led to an international arrest warrant being issued for Vladimir Putin himself. Ukraine says more than 19,000 children have been removed to Russia. Russia maintains that it is evacuating them from danger. The BBC's Eastern Europe correspondent Sarah Rainsford has found new evidence of what is happening to Ukraine's missing children and met some of the relatives fighting to get them back.

programme.title: Women in Charge: Is India Changing?
programme.desc: For so long, women in India have fought for equality at home and the right to be in charge of their families. Now as India marches on to be the world's most populous country, a mini revolution is taking place. Divya Arya meets some of the women, helped by migration and education, who have become the head of their families, and asks what impact it will have on the one point four billion people that now live in India?

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Russia is supplying the Myanmar military with advanced fighter jets and training their pilots how to use them in a war against their own people. More than two years on from the coup, the country's military is facing a countrywide armed uprising and their troops are struggling to hold ground and recruit foot soldiers. So, the strategy is turning increasingly to the air with devastating consequences. BBC's Asia editor Rebecca Henschke follows those fighting back on the ground and in the air. And she meets defectors from the air force who give exclusive insight into the strategy and psychology behind those operating these deadly machines.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc:
The first of two programmes in which Monty travels to Japan in spring to explore different aspects of the nation's gardens. Amidst the cherry blossoms, he begins his journey by visiting the earliest surviving boating garden of the Heian period. He also looks at the rolling green moss of a Buddhist garden and learns the secrets of creating a Zen landscape before visiting an unconventional garden created by a modern design legend. The presenter also learns about the art of Japanese stonemasonry, the famous tea ceremonies and receives a lesson in the delicate art of traditional flower arranging
S01E01

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc:
Circumnavigation: Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him
S01E01

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Mystery Break: Chemotherapy takes its toll on Ester. Jorund tries to make up with Charlotte but suspects she may be hiding bigger secrets. Lars invites love interest Miko on a date. In Norwegian
S01E05

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Zero Point: Ester wonders whether she has the strength to continue with the harshness of her treatment. Arild is invited to Japan on a once-in-a-life time work trip. Jorund gets a nasty shock. In Norwegian
S01E06

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
The Hour of Truth: Ester gets to find out if the treatment she endured has worked. Jorund must decide if he intends to forgive Charlotte, and Finn reveals a big secret he has been carrying around for many years. In Norwegian
S01E07

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc:
The Real Bonnie and Clyde: Timewatch: Documentary about American outlaws Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow. With unprecedented access to gang members' memoirs, family archives and recently released police records, Timewatch searches for the true story of the couple and their mob. While Hollywood portrayed the pair as the most glamorous outlaws in American history, the reality of life on the run was one of violence, hardship and danger. Narrated by Michael Praed
S30E03

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Book Signing: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E07

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Birthday Boy: Bob and Thelma throw a surprise party to cheer up Terry - but the blindfolded guest of honour begins to insult old friends, unaware they are listening to his every word
S01E06

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc:
Circumnavigation: Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him
S01E01

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc:
The first of two programmes in which Monty travels to Japan in spring to explore different aspects of the nation's gardens. Amidst the cherry blossoms, he begins his journey by visiting the earliest surviving boating garden of the Heian period. He also looks at the rolling green moss of a Buddhist garden and learns the secrets of creating a Zen landscape before visiting an unconventional garden created by a modern design legend. The presenter also learns about the art of Japanese stonemasonry, the famous tea ceremonies and receives a lesson in the delicate art of traditional flower arranging
S01E01

programme.title: Holst and Vaughan Williams: Making Music English
programme.desc: Historian Amanda Vickery and broadcaster Tom Service unearth the fascinating story of the life-long friendship between composers Ralph Vaughan Williams and Gustav Holst, whose music gave birth to the 'English sound' in the first half of the 20th century. They retrace the walking trips the two composers took together across the country to discover how influences ranging from the Renaissance masters to the folk genre imbued their music with the 'Englishness' recognised today

programme.title: Inside Classical
programme.desc: The BBC Philharmonic, conducted by Mark Wigglesworth, perform Vaughan Williams' pastoral masterpiece The Lark Ascending, with the orchestra's leader Zoe Beyers on violin. The concert, from Manchester's Bridgewater Hall, also features Elgar's Symphony No 2 and Wagner's prelude to his last music-drama work, Parsifal

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: Clemency Burton-Hill explores the life of Antonio Stradivari, a 17th-century violin-maker who created over one thousand stringed instruments. Visiting the Stradivarius exhibition at the Ashmolean Museum in Oxford, she examines four of the violins and is joined by 2002 Young Musician of the Year winner Jennifer Pike to test some of them out

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: A record-breaking tennis player on the court and a boundary-busting social activist off the court, Billie Jean King talks to Amol Rajan about her extraordinary life and career. She discusses her lifelong battle for equality and inclusion, and how she has balanced her activism with both a sports career and a tumultuous personal life

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary telling the little-known story of sports legend Arthur Ashe off the tennis court. Known to most on account of his stellar sports career - he became the first black man to win Wimbledon in 1975 - the film uncovers Ashe's work as a social activist, a role that embraced not only the civil rights movement in the US and African Americans but all oppressed peoples throughout the world

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Kate Prince: Imagine: Kate Prince is a remarkable British dance pioneer whose renowned ZooNation company has transformed the profile of hip-hop and street dance across the country. Alan Yentob meets the choreographer as she prepares for her project Message in a Bottle, a West End production set to the songs of Sting. The programme follows the highs and lows of birthing a complex new dance show from day one in the studio to opening night, while also exploring the wider impact of Prince's work and politics on a younger generation of upcoming dancers

programme.title: Inside Classical
programme.desc: The BBC Philharmonic, conducted by Mark Wigglesworth, perform Vaughan Williams' pastoral masterpiece The Lark Ascending, with the orchestra's leader Zoe Beyers on violin. The concert, from Manchester's Bridgewater Hall, also features Elgar's Symphony No 2 and Wagner's prelude to his last music-drama work, Parsifal

programme.title: Holst and Vaughan Williams: Making Music English
programme.desc: Historian Amanda Vickery and broadcaster Tom Service unearth the fascinating story of the life-long friendship between composers Ralph Vaughan Williams and Gustav Holst, whose music gave birth to the 'English sound' in the first half of the 20th century. They retrace the walking trips the two composers took together across the country to discover how influences ranging from the Renaissance masters to the folk genre imbued their music with the 'Englishness' recognised today

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose sets off to walk all 630 miles of the South West Coast Path. The explorer hopes to discover wildlife, wild traditions and wild adventure at every turn
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Victorian Splendour: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giles's Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin
S01E06

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Naples: Using 3D scanning technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott uncover the hidden history of three Italian cities, beginning with Naples, from its earliest Greek and Roman origins. The pair explore the impact of the volcano of Mount Vesuvius, and how it both nurtured the region and exacted a terrible price on the local population. Alexander and Michael also delve into a labyrinth of underground spaces constructed by ruling Bourbon kings in the 19th century, that helped to sustain the city
S01E01

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc:
Derby: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri investigate a painting by 18th-century artist Joseph Wright of Derby, housed at the Derby Museum. The piece suffered an industrial scale restoration in the 1970s, but can the team peel back layers of modern restoration on the mysterious landscape painting stuck in the Derby vaults to reveal another hidden masterpiece?
S02E02

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc:
In at the Deep End: HMS Queen Elizabeth goes on dangerous sea trials for the first time in the North Sea, where every part of the vessel is put to the test and the first aircraft lands on the deck. After a few days at sea, the first problems start to emerge, including an explosion, a dangerous fuel leak, and some strange noises. Meanwhile, a crew member reveals how the Navy helped him make a fresh start from a life of crime, and the ship's Muslim chef works out how to cook pork without offending his religion
S01E02

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc:
In Search of the Wreckers: Timewatch: Looters made the most of an opportunity when the MSC Napoli ran aground in January 2007, spilling its cargo on Branscombe beach in Devon. However, they were reviving a tradition that stretches back centuries - connecting coastal communities around Britain to a sinister profession. Author Bella Bathurst embarks on an epic journey from the Isles of Scilly to the Orkney Islands to explore wrecking
S28E03

programme.title: Men at the Barre: Inside the Royal Ballet
programme.desc: Award-winning filmmaker Richard Macer is invited to film with a golden generation of talented young male dancers at the Royal Ballet to find out what it takes to be an elite dancer. Throughout the film, Richard learns that in the past, the man's role was just to lift the ballerina into the air, but now, the top male dancers have fanbases that even rival the best ballerina's. He also explores changes in choreography, which is starting to reflect masculinity in different ways, mirroring the changing perception of what it is to be man outside in the wider world

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose sets off to walk all 630 miles of the South West Coast Path. The explorer hopes to discover wildlife, wild traditions and wild adventure at every turn
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Victorian Splendour: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giles's Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin
S01E06

S01E01

programme.desc:

The piece suffered an industrial scale restoration in the 1970s, but can the team peel back layers of modern restoration on the mysterious landscape painting stuck in the Derby vaults to reveal another hidden masterpiece?
S02E02

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Traversing the rugged and mysterious north Cornish coast, explorer Paul Rose's first stop is Morwenstow, where he squeezes into the Trust's smallest property, the Hawker's Hut. Built in the 1800s by opium-smoking poet Reverend Hawker, it is popular with walkers who add their own graffiti. Next, Paul enjoys a tour of the wild and majestic Tintagel Castle, before heading to Padstow where the Mayday 'Obby 'Oss celebrations are in full swing. Paul is then put through his paces by a group of youngsters training to be surf lifesavers at Newquay's Fistral Beach
S01E02

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc:
Wind, Water and Steam: The former steeplejack sets out on an enthusiastic tour of Britain's industrial heritage, exploring the early use of wind and water power and visiting some steam engines still in use today. On his travels Fred meets a man who has built a windmill in his back garden and hunts for examples of early beam engines that are still functioning today
S01E01

programme.title: The Best of Les Dawson
programme.desc:
Tribute to the comedian featuring clips of some of his best sketches and stand-up routines. First shown in May 1997
S01E03

programme.title: Talking Comedy
programme.desc:
Les Dawson: Talking Comedy: Angela Thorne narrates a look back at clips of the comedian and writer's appearances on some of the BBC's best-loved talk shows
S01E03

programme.title: The Many Faces of
programme.desc:
The Many Faces of Les Dawson: Profile of the Manchester-born comedian known for his deadpan humour and jokes at the expense of his wife and mother-in-law. The programme explores his beginnings in northern clubs and appearance on talent show Opportunity Knocks, and charts his rise to stardom. Contributors include John Cleese, Robert Webb and Russell Kane. Narrated by Sally Phillips
S01E01

programme.title: Brian Cox's Jute Journey
programme.desc: The Succession actor travels to Calcutta, retracing the journey of jute workers who started out in his home city of Dundee and went on to seek their fortunes in India. On the way he meets Lily Thompson, who went deaf while working in the mills, and spent years using a special sign-language to communicate with the other workers. He also meets members of the Calcutta and Moffusil Society and samples deep-fried jute

programme.title: Neutrino: Hunting the Ghost Particle
programme.desc: The astonishing tale of how scientists have battled against the odds to detect and decode the neutrino - the strangest, most elusive particle in the universe

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
What Happens in Helmand: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears
S01E01

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Toy Soldier: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller
S01E02

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Truffle Hog: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn
S01E03

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Traversing the rugged and mysterious north Cornish coast, explorer Paul Rose's first stop is Morwenstow, where he squeezes into the Trust's smallest property, the Hawker's Hut. Built in the 1800s by opium-smoking poet Reverend Hawker, it is popular with walkers who add their own graffiti. Next, Paul enjoys a tour of the wild and majestic Tintagel Castle, before heading to Padstow where the Mayday 'Obby 'Oss celebrations are in full swing. S01E02

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc:

On his travels Fred meets a man who has built a windmill in his back garden and hunts for examples of early beam engines that are still functioning today
S01E01

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose explores the spectacular coastline of southern Cornwall, discovering one of the world's finest stages at the Minack open-air theatre in Porthcurno. He also tries out the high-octane sport of coasteering on the Lizard Peninsula, joins a National Trust ranger for some clifftop wildlife spotting, and fires the Tudor cannons of Pendennis Castle in Falmouth
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc:
Mills and Factories: An exploration of the textile mills and factories that once thrived in Britain during the Industrial Revolution. From New Lanark in Scotland to the mill town of Burnley, Fred meets ex-workers to discover what life was really like, and chats to a group that has dedicated 30 years to restoring mill engines
S01E02

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: The presenter tells the story of the 17th-century residence in Derbyshire - the pleasure palace of playboy Cavalier and ambitious courtier William Cavendish. Through a collection of artworks and items held within the castle, Lucy uncovers a colourful tale, capturing the tensions of England in the 1600s that would eventually lead the nation to civil war

programme.title: Lucy Worsley's Fireworks for a Tudor Queen
programme.desc: The historian teams up with materials scientist Zoe Laughlin in an ambitious attempt to recreate one of the earliest and most spectacular firework displays in Britain. The extravagant festivities were originally laid on by Robert Dudley, a close friend of Queen Elizabeth I, as an attempt win the Virgin Queen's hand in marriage in 1575, and Lucy travels to Italy for clues on how to make the Tudor equivalent of a Catherine Wheel

programme.title: Kisses at Fifty
programme.desc: Bill Maynard stars in Colin Welland's 1973 play about a married factory worker who kisses a barmaid in front of the whole pub on his 50th birthday - and the consequences for all around him. Directed by Michael Apted and co-starring Rosemarie Dunham, Marjorie Yates and Lori Wells

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Blind Spots: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised
S01E04

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
A Pilgrim of Justice: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger
S01E05

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc:
Correction: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama
S01E06

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose explores the spectacular coastline of southern Cornwall, discovering one of the world's finest stages at the Minack open-air theatre in Porthcurno. He also tries out the high-octane sport of coasteering on the Lizard Peninsula, joins a National Trust ranger for some clifftop wildlife spotting, and fires the Tudor cannons of Pendennis Castle in Falmouth
S01E03

programme.desc:

S01E02

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc:
Paul Rose continues his journey by exploring the soft and rolling coastline of south Devon, taking a snorkelling trip around Burgh Island and hitching a ride on the Dartmouth to Paignton steam train
S01E04

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc:
Iron and Steel: The former steeplejack examines the history of the iron and steel industries, beginning with a visit to Ironbridge Gorge in Shropshire. Fred moves on to the Black Country, where he learns how the anchor for the ill-fated Titanic was made, before getting the chance to drive the biggest steam-powered rolling mill engine he has ever seen
S01E03

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga traces the lives of 10 Guinea Street's occupants through the Second World War to the present day, discovering stories of love, loss and renewal. In the run-up to the war, the house is occupied by the younger generation of the Wallingtons, the long-term owners of number 10, who move back to the house after several years living in the rural Somerset. The Wallingtons are letting rooms to lodgers when war is declared in 1939, and would have sheltered in their cellar as German bombs rained down on Bristol. Over the 10 months of the Bristol Blitz, the ancient city is devastated and 3,000 houses destroyed. Number 10 itself is almost among them, as a bomb falls directly on Guinea Street, only missing the house by a whisker
S03E04

programme.title: The Eiger Sanction (1975)
programme.desc: An art professor who once worked as an assassin is blackmailed into returning to his old career to eliminate a spy. However, his target is in the middle of a mountaineering expedition, forcing the hitman to embark on a perilous climb up the Eiger in hot pursuit. Action adventure, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With George Kennedy, Jack Cassidy and Vonetta McGee

programme.title: Hell or High Water (2016)
programme.desc: Divorcee Toby Howard and his ex-con older brother Tanner embark on a meticulously planned crime spree, hoping to rob every branch of the West Texas bank that has threatened to foreclose on their family ranch. However, they soon find themselves being pursued by two veteran Texas Rangers. Neo-Western drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Chris Pine and Ben Foster

programme.title: Lucy Worsley's Fireworks for a Tudor Queen
programme.desc: The historian teams up with materials scientist Zoe Laughlin in an ambitious attempt to recreate one of the earliest and most spectacular firework displays in Britain. The extravagant festivities were originally laid on by Robert Dudley, a close friend of Queen Elizabeth I, as an attempt win the Virgin Queen's hand in marriage in 1575, and Lucy travels to Italy for clues on how to make the Tudor equivalent of a Catherine Wheel

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Michelle Gayle presents studio performances and videos from November 17, 1994, by M People, Suede, Baby D, Blur, Urge Overkill, New Order, Sheryl Crow, Kate Bush and Pato Banton

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier introduces music by Carter the Unstoppable Sex Machine, Jimmy Nail, Louis Armstrong, New Atlantic featuring Berri, Jamiroquai, Kylie Minogue, Sinead O'Connor, Luther Vandross and Baby D from November 24, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 07/06/1984: John Peel and David Jensen host the June 7, 1984 show, featuring Spandau Ballet, Howard Jones, Evelyn Thomas, Bananarama, Bronski Beat and Wham!

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: 08/06/1978: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from June 8, 1978. With music by Manfred Mann's Earth Band, Lindisfarne, the Rolling Stones, Goldie, AC/DC, Boney M, Guy Marks, Maxine Nightingale and David Soul

programme.title: Queens of Soul
programme.desc: A compilation of archive footage to celebrate the critically-acclaimed female singers whose voices have come to define the soul genre, including Aretha Franklin, Roberta Flack, Gladys Knight, Randy Crawford, Angie Stone, Mary J Blige and Beyonce

programme.title: Killing Me Softly: The Roberta Flack Story
programme.desc: A documentary profile of the American singer, best known for her early 1970s hits such as The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face, Where Is the Love and Killing Me Softly with His Song. The programme documents her middle class upbringing, born out of the self-contained hub of a segregated country, and her relative late breakthrough, occurring in her mid thirties. As a solo and duet artist she had her detractors for adapting her style to white traditions, but eventually won over a nation with her soft, gentle tones. Contributors include Dionne Warwick, Johnny Mathis and Cissy Houston, as well as several reflections from Flack herself

programme.title: Aretha Franklin: Duets
programme.desc: Admirers including Elton John, Gloria Estefan, Smokey Robinson, PM Dawn, Bonnie Raitt and Rod Stewart share a stage with the Queen of Soul. The concert took place at Manhattan's Nederlander Theatre in 1993, as an AIDS benefit. Elton, Smokey and Rod provide backing vocals on the first number Chain of Fools

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: Aretha Franklin: A Tribute to the Queen of Soul at the Proms: In a concert from last year's BBC Proms, Jules Buckley and his ensemble are joined by American singer and Quincy Jones protégée Sheléa to showcase the songs made famous by the Queen of Soul. Presented by Clara Amfo from the Royal Albert Hall

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Michelle Gayle presents studio performances and videos from November 17, 1994, by M People, Suede, Baby D, Blur, Urge Overkill, New Order, Sheryl Crow, Kate Bush and Pato Banton

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier introduces music by Carter the Unstoppable Sex Machine, Jimmy Nail, Louis Armstrong, New Atlantic featuring Berri, Jamiroquai, Kylie Minogue, Sinead O'Connor, Luther Vandross and Baby D from November 24, 1994

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc:
Part two of two. Monty explores the country during autumn, beginning at one of the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they are protected from the coming winter. Monty follows the history of the Japanese garden through the military strongholds of past leaders to the many styles, new and old, of the iconic stroll garden and finds a slice of Victorian England in the heart of Tokyo. He also learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle. He ends his journey by the Sea of Japan at a place that makes art out of its gardens
S01E02

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc:
The Making of Captain Cook: Paul Rose tells the story of Captain James Cook's historic 1768 voyage to find a vast southern continent. No such land mass was discovered, but the crew of the Endeavour went on to Tahiti and Australia, which Cook claimed for Britain. The ship was almost ripped apart on the Great Barrier Reef, but the captain's navigational skills eventually steered it back home to safety
S01E02

programme.title: Law of Tehran
programme.desc: Crime thriller about a dedicated police officer's relentless pursuit of a drug kingpin, leading him down a dark path rife with corruption and shifting morality. Starring Payman Maadi and Navid Mohammadzadeh. In Persian

programme.title: The Best of Les Dawson
programme.desc:
Tribute to the comedian featuring clips of some of his best sketches and stand-up routines. First shown in May 1997

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 1/5: In Swansea, performing arts director Anthony plans a theatre-themed menu for his guests, Ross, Tula, Kola and Julie. However, straight-talking Tula tries to steal the show with a candid revelation and Julie brings the house down with some frisky fun at Kola's expense. Anthony's plans go awry in the kitchen, threatening to earn him more rotten earn tomatoes than rave reviews

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 2/5: Salesman Ross hosts the second party from Swansea, but his guests make a discovery that leaves him with some explaining to do, while tension erupts between him and Kola

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 3/5: Social carer Kola provides plenty of hip-hop swagger on the third day of the contest in Swansea, with a Nigerian menu he hopes will both educate and impress his fellow diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 4/5: Triathlete Tula serves a Spanish-themed menu in Swansea, hoping charm and chorizo can smooth over the dispute between Ross and Julie and avoid a punch-up over the paella

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Swansea 5/5: Social worker Julie plans a chilled out slumber party for the final night of the week in Swansea. She cooks a homely menu, but struggles with the pronunciation as well as the preparation of some of her ingredients. At the end of another eventful evening, the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc:
Accounts manager Courtney and kitchen and bedroom fitter Scott are teamed up to transform a crumbling house bought at auction into a dream home
S02E01

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc:
Wannabe property developers and plasterers Rees and Oliver are paired up to transform a dated terraced house bought at auction into an inviting home with curb appeal
S02E02

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc:
Kirkstall, Leeds: Plumber Veronica and joiner Stevie get together for the first time to turn a tired auction property in West Yorkshire into a spanking new family home
S02E03

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2020: Tenerife: Laura Hamilton helps Amando and Vanessa from the West Midlands find a holiday home in Tenerife, tracking down five properties within their budget of £185,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2014: South Tenerife: Jasmine Harman helps Bedfordshire couple Dean and Karen Dhinsa find a rural retreat in southern Tenerife. The pair dream of spending their retirement in a sunny climate, and are looking for a home within easy reach of the island's beaches, complete with a cave to transform into a cinema, all on a budget of £180,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2014: Lanzarote: Jasmine Harman helps Bedfordshire couple Liz and Grahame Pink, who have saved hard for their dream holiday home in Lanzarote and have a budget of £63,000 to spend on a property

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2014: Fuerteventura: Emma Greenfield and Daniel Halley search for a home on the Canary Island of Fuerteventura with a budget of £73,000. Presenter Jasmine Harman is on hand to show them a selection of properties on the market

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Charente, Western France: Jasmine Harman pulls out all the stops around the Charente region of western France to find Debbie and Guy a home where they can start up their own gîte business

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Western Dordogne: Janine and Mark from Stockport, Greater Manchester, are hoping to find their perfect holiday home around the western Dordogne region in France. Married for 20 years and with two grown-up children, they feel now is the right time to buy their dream home in their favourite holiday spot. Laura Hamilton tries to deliver their dreams on their budget of £230,000

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc:
A VW and a Bomb Shelter: George explores more inspirational and ingenious amazing spaces. A father in Norfolk renovates a Volkswagen van to surprise his camping-mad kids, while a couple on the Isle of Wight turn a brick bomb shelter into a bijou bar. Master craftsman Will Hardie checks out a Russian-inspired Grayson Perry creation on the banks of the River Stour in Essex. Plus, George and Will move one step closer to completing their studio flat prototype
S10E06

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Tenby, 2011: Kevin McCloud meets Tim and Philomena O'Donovan, who are trying to convert the old lifeboat station in Tenby, Pembrokeshire, into a contemporary home and preserve the historic building for posterity. A weather-worn, rusting and rotting hulk that was never designed for habitation, it is perched on a steel pier 40ft above the sea and can only be reached by crossing the sandy beach at low tide
S11E04

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Chatterbox Live
programme.desc: Stand-up show recorded at London's Bloomsbury Theatre in 2011, in which the comedienne shares humorous insights into her life, including the perils of living alone, and offers advice on such topics as non-fattening stress relief, the alternative to marriage and the acceptable face of adultery

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
Claire, 46, has been sent to A&E by her GP with chronic back pain, and doctors soon realise she may be suffering a serious underlying spinal injury. Anne Marie has been rushed to St George's following a suspected stroke, and staff have to act quickly to help prevent any long-lasting damage, while five-day-old Gracie is brought in by new parents Danny and Jordan, concerned she has an infected umbilical cord
S24E08

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E15

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including SAS: Who Dares Wins, Bridgerton, Freeze the Fear with Wim Hof, The 1% Club, Get Organized with the Home Edit, Made in Chelsea. Plus ITV news coverage of Rishi Sunak and the BBC's coverage of 'Partygate' fines
S19E09

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
A Yardstick for Failure: The grand final finds courageous contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin fighting to gain the most points to win Greg Davies's golden head. For their last act, they contemplate using a hose, create something soothing for two very specific professions and have an incredibly intense game of face-changing chess with Alex Horne, but who will reign supreme in this unparalleled gladiatorial arena?
S15E10

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: A look at back at the rich tapestry of the show's pickers, from the people who shared all their darkest secrets to the time when a polyamorous couple picked a date on the show. This episode also catch up with some of our most memorable pickers, including Emmy-Lou and Glynn

programme.title: Untold: The Secret World of Boy Racers
programme.desc: Ben Zand investigates the secretive world of the UK's new boy racers and rides along as they reach terrifying speeds, such as 170mph races on public motorways in the dead of night. He meets those running social media accounts with tens of thousands of followers viewing extreme, dangerous and even illegal driving, and heads to car meets across the UK. He witnesses first-hand how some of this new generation of car enthusiasts revel in a game of cat-and-mouse with police

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Gloucestershire to meet Bryan, who's been collecting everything and anything since childhood. Henry upcycles some old oxygen regulators into bedside lamps, while Simon settles for restoring a stylish and traditional wooden dresser
S06E15

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Davina McCall's Pill Revolution
programme.desc: In recent years use of the contraceptive pill has reduced, while natural family planning methods have grown in popularity. programme.title: Lantana (2001)
programme.desc: The relationships of four couples living in Sydney become entangled after the discovery of an unidentified corpse. Among them is the detective in charge of the case, who is cheating on his wife with a psychiatrist - who in turn has issues about her child, a murder victim, and is also concerned her aloof academic husband might be gay. Drama, starring Geoffrey Rush, Barbara Hershey and Anthony LaPaglia

programme.title: Inside Llewyn Davis (2013)
programme.desc: An aspiring musician struggles to make a name for himself in the Greenwich village folk scene of early 1960s New York. As he pursues an audition with an influential music mogul, he comes across a series of obstacles - many of his own making. The Coen brothers' drama, starring Oscar Isaac, Carey Mulligan, John Goodman and Justin Timberlake

programme.title: Experimenter (2015)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the controversial social psychology experiments carried out at Yale University by Stanley Milgram in 1961, in which he tested ordinary humans' willingness to obey authority. Peter Sarsgaard and Winona Ryder star

programme.title: Bone Tomahawk (2015)
programme.desc: After an outlaw unknowingly leads a band of cannibalistic cave-dwellers into the peaceful town of Bright Hope, the elderly sheriff rounds up a posse to rescue townsfolk abducted by the ferocious tribesmen. Western horror, starring Kurt Russell and Patrick Wilson

programme.title: Ghost Writer (2007)
programme.desc: A composer takes in a penniless writer, but when he realises his kindness is being cruelly exploited, he kills his guest in a fit of rage. To make up for his crime, he arranges to have the dead author's last work posthumously published - but when he takes credit for the work, his victim's spirit returns to haunt him. Black comedy, directed by and starring Alan Cumming. With David Boreanaz and Anne Heche

programme.title: Chi-Raq (2015)
programme.desc: Spike Lee's dark comic drama with Nick Cannon. After a child is killed by a stray bullet, a group of women find a unique way to take on the violence in Chicago's Southside by withholding sex. Spike Lee's comedy crime drama, starring Nick Cannon

programme.title: To the Wonder (2012)
programme.desc: An American tourist in Paris falls in love with a French single mother, and hastily marries her before bringing her home with him to Oklahoma. As their passion cools, they each seek solace in relationships with others - she turns to a fellow immigrant, a priest who is losing his faith, while her husband is reunited with an old flame. Terrence Malick's drama, starring Ben Affleck, Olga Kurylenko, Rachel McAdams and Javier Bardem

programme.title: Angel Heart (1987)
programme.desc: A shady 1950s private eye is hired by a mysterious stranger to find a missing singer with a debt to pay. The detective's search for the musician leads him into dark and disturbing territory, as everybody who helps him meets a grisly fate. However, the truth is far more shocking than he ever expected. Supernatural thriller, starring Mickey Rourke, Robert De Niro, Lisa Bonet and Charlotte Rampling

programme.title: Dancing at the Blue Iguana (2002)
programme.desc: A group of women working at a seedy Los Angeles strip club discuss their trials and triumphs, from pregnancy and abortion to the never-ending search for stardom. Downbeat drama, starring Daryl Hannah, Jennifer Tilly, Sandra Oh and Charlotte Ayanne

programme.title: Lantana (2001)
programme.desc: The relationships of four couples living in Sydney become entangled after the discovery of an unidentified corpse. Among them is the detective in charge of the case, who is cheating on his wife with a psychiatrist - who in turn has issues about her child, a murder victim, and is also concerned her aloof academic husband might be gay. Drama, starring Geoffrey Rush, Barbara Hershey and Anthony LaPaglia

programme.title: Sunshine Cleaning (2008)
programme.desc: A single mother struggles to make ends meet and hopes to send her seven-year-old son to private school. She hits upon the idea of starting a business cleaning up crime scenes and places where dead bodies have been discovered, and recruits her directionless younger sister to help. Comedy drama, starring Amy Adams, Emily Blunt and Alan Arkin
